item.title: "I was wrong"
item.description: Anyone saying these words is a friend of mine

item.title: Native binary debugging for OCaml (written by Claude!)
item.description:
Discuss on Hacker News or Twitter.
Debugging Native OCaml Code with DWARF
When you compile OCaml to native code and try to debug it, lldb can’t show you much: breakpoints don’t resolve, source lines don’t appear, and variable names look meaningless.
That’s not the debugger’s

item.title: How to work with Product: At the tea table
How to Use Cloudfront for Sendgrid Click Tracking
item.description: Nothing like a Cloudflare outage to inspire another blog post. I learned from the last incident and was able to turn off the CF proxy early on while it was still possible to do so. This kept my website up during most of the outage as requests were bypassing CF and hitting my origin servers directly.
item.author: (rozumem)

item.title: Don't sleep on MCP
item.description: It’s not just an upgrade to tool calls. Why Anthropic’s Model Context Protocol is a glimpse into the future of LLM-centric software.

item.title: Building the foundations of an 'AI CEO'
Why your retrospectives don't work and how to fix them
item.description: Hot takes and cold truths on software, startups, and the lies we tell ourselves.

item.title: Build vs Buy: What This Week's Outages Should Teach You
item.description: The simple rule everyone gets wrong: build what makes you unique, buy what makes you run. But whatever you do, make sure you understand it well enough to fix it when it breaks. Because it will break.

item.title: Why is Browser Observability Hard | Hazel Weakly
item.description: So the big thing that makes everything so difficult for browsers is that opentelemetry has a concept of a lifecycle for telemetry that doesn’t map very well to...

item.title: Are large language models worth it?
item.description: Are the harms that LLMs have caused, and will soon cause, worth the benefits they may bring? This article (a written version of a keynote talk I gave at CoLM) tries to explore this question.

item.title: How to Play Responsibility Dodgeball in an Organization | Joe IQ
item.description: The corporate game is to avoid responsibility. These are the plays.

item.title: Building more with GPT-5.1-Codex-Max
item.description: Introducing GPT-5.1-Codex-Max, a faster, more intelligent agentic coding model for Codex. The model is designed for long-running, project-scale work with enhanced reasoning and token efficiency.

item.title: Linus Torvalds: Vibe coding is fine, but not for production
item.description: : Linux inventor also discusses Rust in the kernel, Nvidia's proprietary code, and the problem of AI crawlers

item.title: Emulator Bugs: Sega CD | jsgroth's blog
item.description: Here are two bugs that I ran into while adding Sega CD support to my Genesis emulator, both related to emulating the Sega CD’s CD-ROM hardware. These are from a while ago but I think they’re still interesting enough to write about.

item.title: Your Smartphone, Their Rules: How App Stores Enable Corporate-Government Censorship | ACLU
item.description: Big Tech Oligopoly helps the Trump Administration crack down on free speech

item.title: How much does it cost to make a video game?
item.description: We built a model to estimate the budget of 100,000 games. Here's what we found.

item.title: Microsoft steers Aspire to a polyglot future
item.description: Microsoft’s cloud-native, distributed application development tool kit drops .NET from its name and embraces, well, everything.

item.title: Cloudflare outage on November 18, 2025
item.description: Cloudflare suffered a service outage on November 18, 2025. The outage was triggered by a bug in generation logic for a Bot Management feature file causing many Cloudflare services to be affected.
